conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D isometric/cutaway: extruded walls with visible thickness, angled view with multiple wall faces, and ceiling/roof removed to expose interior volumes.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and readable interior volume; good isometric-like viewpoint; clean cutaway with intact wall corners and floor separation. Minor simplification of some junction details.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and adjacencies match (garage, living, kitchen/pantry, theatre, activity, alfresco, master/ensuite/WIR, study, laundry/bath/WC, secondary beds). Some minor discrepancies/labeling inconsistencies and small proportional shifts in a few spaces/openings compared with the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture blocks present in living, dining/alfresco, beds, and theatre; kitchen island/benches represented; bathrooms show simplified fixtures. Some elements are minimal and not all fixtures/details from the 2D plan are fully expressed.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is clean and easy to read with consistent materials and good visibility. Deduction for floor text/labels being embedded in the 3D render and for limited explicit door/window detailing.

detected_errors.description: Text labels/dimensions from the plan are present on the 3D floor surfaces, reducing presentation cleanliness.
Doors/windows are not consistently modeled with clear frames/swing indications; some openings are simplified versus the 2D plan.
Furniture and fixtures are simplified block-outs; some bathroom/kitchen details are not fully faithful to the plan’s fixture layout.

summary: A true and clean 3D cutaway conversion with strong overall layout fidelity, minor opening/detail simplifications, and plan text carried into the render.
